Where will Micron technology be in one year's time?
Micron Technology (MU -1.10%) has fallen by 47% over the last 12 months, and the results of the company for the first quarter of the fiscal year 2023, which were issued last week, indicate that the prices will get worse for the manufacturer of  ' up in 2023.
The memory specialist saw a sharp drop in revenue in the most recent quarter, which ended on 1 December, and he was lost in comparison with a profit in the previous year. It suggests that the current quarter guidance is the difficult times that are here to stay for a while. However, the direction is that the fortunes of the memory sector could start to change by mid-2023 when customers start to supply chips.
Let's take a look at whether Micron will be in a better position in a year.
The poor memory demand has affected Micron technology.
Micron's first quarter tax revenues fell by a maximum of 47% on a yearly basis to $4.1 billion, due to a combination of lower memory shipments and a sharp fall in prices. This has also led to a sharp fall in margin. The company's adjusted gross margin fell to 22.9% from 47% in the previous quarter.
It is no surprise that Micron recorded a revised loss of $0.04 per action compared to a useful $2.16 in the previous year. The company's leadership suggests that things are getting worse. Management provides for a adjusted gross margin of just 8.5% in this quarter, down by almost 40 percentage points compared to the same period a year ago. The company has projected an adjusted loss of $0.62 per action compared to a value of $2.14 per action during the previous year.
Analysts do not expect a trend reversal throughout the fiscal year, with a 42% drop in revenues of $17.9 billion and a adjusted loss of $0.10 per share compared with the earnings of $8.35 per share last year.
This is not surprising because the memory chip application has weakened after a decline in personal computer sales (PC) and smartphones.
And the application for memory chips implemented in servers and graphics cards is also slow. All this has created an excess of memory chip offers. Consequently, the price of memory chips for dynamic random access (DRAM) should fall between 13% and 18% in the current quarter, worse than the 10-15% decline in the third quarter.
This explains Micron's painful leadership. But at the same time, the direction has indicated that there could be a trend reversal in 2023.
Things will change over the next few months.
CEO Sanjay Mereotra said during the last teleconference that “the customer inventory, which is influencing short-term demand, should continue to improve and we expect that most customers will have reduced the inventory at relatively healthy levels,” said half of the 2023 calendar. We therefore expect that the revenue of the second half of the fiscal year will improve from the first half of our fiscal year’.
But Mereotra added that profitability could “be in question until 2023.” But investors can expect that an improvement in memory chip demand will lead to better margins, because companies operating in this sector are cutting investment and withdrawing production because of weak demand.
Micron's prediction of a trend reversal in memory demand is in line with other third-party projections. So things could start to improve for Micron in the second half of 2023 with the return of memory chip demand, but it might take us time to restore the balance between demand and offer and prices start to rise.
In particular, DRAM’s demand for DRAM bits should only increase by 8.3% in 2023, which would be the first increase below 10% in history. Add production cuts by companies such as Micron, which is reducing production to 20%, and the memory industry could be close to achieving a balance between demand and supply.
But Micron will probably not regain his 2024 move. PC sales should resume in 2024, while smartphone sales should take a break from the second half of 2023. As demand starts to rise and supply is restricted, the price drop to which the memory industry is seeing is going to decline.
As a result, Micron is expected to perform significantly better in the fiscal year 2024 (which will begin in September 2023). Analysts predict an increase in revenue by 42% and a return to profitability in the fiscal year 2024, followed by another solid year in the fiscal year 2025.
UM EPS estimates for the current fiscal year; data from Graphics Y.
So Micron Technology could be in a much stronger position after a year, even though a couple of important things will have to go into place because this is happening: an improvement in demand and a limited supply.
Investors would do well to keep a potential reversal of trend and keep it in their 2023 control list, as it has a good performance story during a memory boom cycle.
Duro Chauhan does not hold any position in any of the titles mentioned. The Motley Fool has no position in any of the titles mentioned. Motley Fool has a policy of disclosure.
Best Buy on the market on the market: Lucid vs. Rivian shares
The last year of trading has generally been brutal for electric vehicles (EV) actions, and the smaller players in the space have been particularly affected. From the assessment point of view, the Ludo Group (LCID 1.94%) and Rivian Automotive (RIVN -1.60%) have been among the biggest losers in the last 12 months, with each title falling more than 80% over the entire period.
But while the prices of shares for companies in space have collapsed, it is unlikely that the long-term prospects for the revolution in electric vehicles have been distorted. Which of these two EV players will be shown the best good-and-hold title? That is why two Motley Fool contributors are on the opposite sides of the debate.
Image Source: Getty Images.
Consumers cannot get enough electric vehicles.
Parkev Tatevosian (Rivian): Rivian benefits from a strong favourable wind while consumers turn to electric vehicles. This trend is likely to persist, as governments are subsidies to industry to encourage wider adoption.
Rivian is growing at a rate of vagrant: in its most recent quarter, the company has increased its vehicle production by 67% compared to the previous quarter. With a portfolio of more than 114,000 orders, production is the crucial element.
In addition to the above, Rivian has an order of 100,000 electric vans from Amazonia, and the direction has reiterated that the company will probably produce 25,000 vehicles in 2022. With 14 billion dollars on the 30th of September, there is certainly no lack of resources to do so. But the question remains: Can Rivian increase production efficiently?
For now, society is not profitable and is losing money. In his most recent quarter, he lost $1.7 billion in profits. For the nine months that ended on 30 September, its losses were worth USD 5 billion.
Its fashion cars and government incentives ensure a strong demand from customers. Investors could earn huge rewards if Rivian manages to get the right production process.
However, investors should bear in mind that this will not be an easy undertaking. In other words, the potential reward for investment in Rivian also entails considerable risk.
Focusing on the market for Pemium electric vehicles
Keith Noonan (Luido): In addition to a mix of macroeconomic pressures, Lucid has faced production challenges and a decline in investor enthusiasm for the wider EV space over the past year. The title has fallen by about 89% compared to its highest historical level, and the electric vehicle specialist now has a market capitalisation of about $11.3 billion.
With the potential for a recession to model much of the operating environment in 2023, it is possible that the largest car space will be going badly over the next year. Smaller electric vehicles, in particular, could see negative effects. But Lucid presents a potentially explosive opportunity despite his certainly significant risk profile.
The activity is expanding rapidly and is currently being exchanged around 4.3 times the sales planned for next year, opening the door to market-wide market turbulence. But it also leaves room for an explosive appreciation of capital if the company can realize its vision.
With rapid growth and the company's attention on the ultra-premium segment of the electric car market that creates the opportunity for strong margins, Lucid could be more easily turned to profitability and productivity growth than many of his colleagues in the sector.
Lucid's attention to luxury beers could help her to distinguish herself from the increasingly crowded electric car market, and his transition to luxury SUVs with the launch of his 2024 Gravity model could prove successful.
Even after big sales, Lucid remains a high-risk title. It is possible that the company's vision for growth in the electric vehicle sector is not going to go well and the price of its actions still has room for a constant drop in the current levels.
Basically, Lucid remains in the first stages of accelerating production and sales initiatives, and this also entails risks following a dramatic contraction of the assessments. But there's a great potential here too.
What is the best way to buy?
Revian and Lucid distinguish themselves from high-risk and high-performance actions. While it remains at a relatively early stage in implementing its long-term growth strategy, Rivian's activity is currently in a more developed state. His agreements with business partners, including Amazon, represent significant vote of confidence and contribute to creating greater security for its performance prospects.
Meanwhile, the Lucid title seems even more risky at current levels, but its attention to the luxury car market could potentially bring great gains across the line.
If they choose between the two titles, investors should underestimate the individual strengths of each company and the different approach to the electric car market and decide on what strategy it looks more attractive to them.
John Mackey, CEO of the Whole Foods Market, is a member of The Motley Fool's board of directors. Keith Noonan does not hold any position in any of the titles mentioned. While 2022 is over, many people have faced the most challenging investment year of their lives. The S&P 500 and Nasdaq Component are both in a bottom-up market and on the way to the night, the worst performance of the year since 2008. And many experts are asking for more pain in the light of next year.
A survey of 18 investment banks concluded with a consensus S&P 500 for 2023 of just 4,031, with many Wall Street banks expecting the S&P 500 to have a first half of the year and a second difficult second. Inflation shows signs of slowing down. But even if inflation were to fall, a continuing decline in the housing market and rising unemployment could still trigger a recession. With so much uncertainty in the air, it can be intimidating for investors to press the buying button.
Although the sale has stimulated an excellent opportunity to buy for many leading companies in the sector, the communications sector is distinguished as a particularly good place to invest in 2023 and beyond. That's why.
Abbreviating the communications sector
When investors think about the communications sector, they could think of similar AT&T telecommunications companies (T-0.22%), T-Mobile (TMUS 0.43%) verified (VZ 0.36%) – as well as Walt Disney (DIS-0.3C%, NetX1, 0.34%) and 3.36% (DIS-0.3C .

stories.body:
Alveni Lisboa  Neste artigo:  GOOGL  Ano novo chegando e com ele as famosas metas para a virada vêm juntas.
É nessa hora que alguns aplicativos para celular podem ajudar a organizar os propósitos para o novo ciclo que se inicia na passagem do dia 31 de dezembro para 1º de janeiro.
  Embora nada mude de um dia para o outro, as pessoas criaram o hábito de traçar seu planejamento no Réveillon, definindo objetivos e ações necessárias para começar o ano com o pé direito. É preciso registrar tudo por escrito (ou em apps) para acompanhar nos próximos 365 dias.
  Os antepassados faziam as anotações nas paredes das cavernas ou em folhas de papel, mas você pode traçar suas metas de ano novo no seu Android ou iOS. Alguns aplicativos podem facilitar demais esse trabalho, inclusive fazendo o acompanhamento de modo automático ou possibilitando a consulta rápida no dia a dia.
  Apps para organizar as suas metas de Ano Novo
  7. QuitNow
  O QuitNow pode ajudar a resolver a meta de parar de fumar no novo ano (Imagem: Reprodução/Google Play Store)
  O QuitNow é um aplicativo que permite realizar uma das resoluções mais importantes de Ano Novo: parar de fumar. Se você já prometeu largar o vício antes, mas talvez não tenha conseguido por alguma razão, essa solução pode ajudar.
  O programa conta com recursos interessantes de gamificação para incentivar quem vai parar com o cigarro. São inúmeras conquistas para serem desbloqueadas, que ajudam a dar aquela motivada diária na batalha contra o vício.
  Além disso, o usuário terá com uma grande comunidade de ex-fumantes para conversar. É possível encontrar gente do mundo inteiro que conseguiu se livrar do cigarro com ajuda do QuitNow.
  Tenha acesso ainda a dados curiosos como o tempo (dias, horas e minutos) desde o último cigarro, quantos maços foram evitados e a quantidade de dinheiro economizada no ano. Se você quer parar de fumar no próximo ano, esta solução pode tirar ao menos um item da sua lista de propósitos, afinal o acompanhamento será diário no seu celular.
  O Headspace ajuda a relaxar e a dormir melhor no ano que vai chegar (Imagem: Rodrigo Folter/Canaltech)
  O Headspace é o aplicativo ideal para quem precisa começar o próximo ano com a saúde mental em dia. O serviço apresenta exercícios diários para relaxamento, meditação e concentração. É um ótimo aliado para se usar no trajeto do trabalho para casa ou enquanto está descansando no sofá.
  Com atividades simples e rápidas, as pessoas podem ter uma qualidade de vida muito melhor, com mais calma e sem estresse. O foco é traçar um plano de ação para combater a principal queixa do usuário, sem exigir longos deslocamentos ou dedicação integral às tarefas.
  O plano gratuito tem mais de 40 cursos temáticos de meditação para diversos temas. São oferecidas também práticas guiadas por especialistas para preparar seu corpo para um sono mais saudável — inclusive, dá para colocar alguns sons relaxantes de fundo para ajudar a adormecer.
  Quem usa o Headspace nem precisa adicionar questões de saúde mental na sua listinha de resoluções, afinal o próprio app mostrará dados evolutivos da prática. Tá estressado? Comece o ano mais zen
  O Notas é o app de anotações nativo do iOS, portanto você nem precisa baixar nada se não quiser (Imagem: André Magalhães/Canaltech)
  O Notas é o aplicativo oficial do iOS para fazer anotações rápidas no celular. Ele funciona basicamente como um bloco de notas, mas tem algumas funções inclusas excelentes para quem deseja traçar e acompanhar as metas do ano novo.
  O programa possui várias opções de formatação, suporte a anexos e desenhos à mão livre. É possível também criar listas com campos que podem ser marcados ao concluir determinada tarefa ou alcançar algum objetivo.
  Uma das vantagens é a possibilidade de organizar as notas em pastas, o que permite criar uma área exclusiva para suas metas anuais. Assim, você poderá lidar com arquivos mensais ou rever o planejamento do ano passado rapidamente.
  Quem possui outros dispositivos da ainda poderá sincronizar as notas entre eles, o que dá mais liberdade para gerenciar as metas pelo computador, celular ou que ganhou de Natal.
  O Keep permite adicionar metas de ano novo com prazo e até local de execução (Imagem: André Magalhães/Canaltech)
  O Keep é um aplicativo de bloco de notas com integração com os serviços do . Ou seja, quem possui Android também pode usar um bom software para registrar suas metas de ano novo.
  O app faz basicamente tudo que o Notas faz — listas, fontes, formatação, anexos e outros —, mas com o diferencial de ser acessível pelo Gmail e pelo Chrome. Esta vantagem dá ao Keep a possibilidade de ser usado até em outros sistemas operacionais móveis e no computador.
  Uma funcionalidade bacana são as notas compartilhadas, o que permite um uso colaborativo entre membros da família ou no trabalho. Você pode criar objetivos de Réveillon coletivos para o ano seguinte e monitorar tudo de modo simples.
  Além de receber anotações, o permite criar listas, lidar com mídias e escanear documentos (Imagem: André Magalhães/Canaltech)
  O Evernote é a ferramenta mais antiga dessa lista, mas é uma das mais completas. Além das tradicionais anotações, o recurso permite integrar sua lista de objetivos em plataformas de terceiros, como Gmail e , ou acessá-lo por navegador, celular e tablet.
  Se você gosta de trabalhar à moda antiga, pode fazer as metas em papel e digitalizá-lo em formato de documento. É possível associar listas a fluxos de trabalho, bem como salvar as notas como páginas da web.
  Tal qual um bom redator de anotações, o Evernote permite lidar com formatações diversas e mídias anexadas. Você pode definir seus objetivos de ano novo associados a notas de áudio ou imagens para fornecer contexto.
  Há planos de assinatura gratuita ou pagos, portanto o usuário poderá escolher qual atende a sua necessidade. Se não quiser pagar, dá para usá-lo sem dificuldades, assim você começa o ano com mais dinheiro no bolso.
  O Nomo ajuda quem pretende ficar sóbrio ou se livrar de algum vício (Imagem: Reprodução/Google Play Store)
  O Nomo é um ótimo aplicativo para ajudar no cumprimento da meta de parar de beber no ano novo. Se você andou exagerando no álcool ultimamente, este app será um bom aliado para se manter sóbrio.
  Criado por um ex-dependente de álcool, o serviço permite a criação de alertas cotidianos para mantê-lo motivado no propósito. Além disso, o usuário pode adicionar pessoas que atuaram como braço direito (e contato de emergência) na missão de evitar bebidas alcoólicas.
  O Nomo cria uma espécie de relógio de registro com dados sobre a resolução: quanto tempo está sem beber, dias em sequência, dinheiro economizado e relatos de outros ex-dependentes. Embora seja focado no consumo de álcool, o app permite configurar outras finalidades como drogas, pornografia e cigarro.
  Por fim, vale destacar os exercícios de distração que ajudam a reorientar a mente quanto a pessoa está tentada. Neste momento, é preciso estimular a mente com outas coisas para não ter recaída no vício.
  O Way of Life permite transformar suas listas do ano novo em lembretes intuitivos (Imagem: Reprodução/Google Play Store)
  O Way of Life é um aplicativo para mudar hábitos antigos e criar novos, mais saudáveis e de acordo com seu planejamento. Não basta apenas escrever suas resoluções de fim de ano, pois de nada adiantará se não colocá-las em prática.
  O programa tem um rastreador intuitivo de hábitos que permite acompanhar diariamente a evolução. A promessa é gastar menos de um minuto para responder a perguntas sobre a mudança de seus costumes indesejados, como falta de atividade física, sono ruim ou excesso de bebidas alcoólicas.
  Informações rotineiras são coletadas para identificar se suas metas estão sendo cumpridas. Não há restrição do que o app pode monitorar, então dá para usar para coisas pessoais ou até para o trabalho.
  O Way of Life pode funcionar melhor que qualquer lista porque apresenta lembretes para datas comemorativas, dias da semana e horários específicos. Dá para adicionar lembretes personalizados que ajudam a compreender o porquê daquele alerta.
  Curtiu a lista de apps para fazer as resoluções do Réveillon? O Canaltech deseja um feliz Ano Novo!

en.body:
I have come to Lisbon in this article: GOOGL New Year arriving and with it the famous goals for the turn come together.
It is at this time that some mobile applications can help organise the purposes for the new cycle that begins in the course of 31 December to 1 January.
Although nothing changes from day to day, people have created the habit of drawing their planning in Riveillon, defining the objectives and actions necessary to start the year with the right foot. Everything must be recorded in writing (or in apps) to follow up on the next 365 days.
The ancestors did annotations on the walls of the caves or in paper sheets, but you can draw your new year goals in your Android or iOS. Some applications can facilitate this work too much, including by automatically monitoring or enabling quick consultation on a daily basis.
Apps to organize their New Year goals
7. QuitNow
QuitNow can help solve the goal of stopping smoking in the new year (Image: Reproduction/Google Play Store)
QuitNow is an application that allows one of the most important New Year's resolutions: stop smoking. If you've already promised to leave the gap before, but maybe you haven't been able to do it for any reason, that solution can help.
The programme has interesting gamification resources to encourage those who are going to stop smoking. There are numerous achievements to be blocked, which help to give that daily motivation in the fight against fraud.
In addition, the user will have a large community of ex-fumators to talk about. You can find people from all over the world who have managed to get rid of the cigarette with the help of QuitNow.
It also has access to curious data such as time (days, hours and minutes) since the last cigarette, how many matches have been avoided and the amount of money saved in the year. If you want to stop smoking next year, this solution can take at least one item from your list of purposes, after all, monitoring will be daily in your cell phone.
Headspace helps to relax and sleep better in the year to come (Image: Rodrigo Folter/Canaltech)
The Headspace is the ideal application for those who need to start next year with mental health. The service shall provide daily exercises for relaxation, meditation and concentration. It's a great ally to use in the work trip home or while you're resting on the couch.
With simple and rapid activities, people can have a much better quality of life, with more calm and without stress. The focus is to draw up an action plan to combat the main user's complaint, without requiring long travel or full commitment to tasks.
The free plan has over 40 thematic meditation courses for various topics. It also offers expert-guided practices to prepare your body for a healthier — including, to put some background relaxing sounds to help you sleep.
Anyone who uses Headspace or need to add mental health issues to their resolution list will ultimately show the evolutionary data of the practice itself. Is it a surprise? Starts the year of the tiniest
Note is the native annotations app of iOS, so you don't need to lower anything if you don't want to (Image: André Magalhães/Canaltech)
Note is the official iOS application to make quick annotations on the cell. It works basically like a block of notes, but has some excellent features for those who want to draw and follow the goals of the new year.
The programme has several formatting options, supports free hand-made annexes and designs. It is also possible to create lists of fields that can be marked by the completion of a particular task or achieving some objective.
One advantage is the possibility of organizing notes in passports, which allows for the creation of an exclusive area for their annual targets. So you can deal with monthly archives or review last year's planning quickly.
Anyone who has other devices of the system can synchronize notes between them, which gives more freedom to manage the goals by the computer, cell phone or that won from Christmas.
The Keep allows adding new year targets with a time limit and even a place of execution (Image: André Magalhães/Canaltech)
The Keep is a non-component, integrated note blocker with the services of the ..i.e., those who own Android can also use good software to record their new year goals.
The app basically does everything the Note does — lists, sources, formats, attachments, and others — but with the differential of being accessible by Gmail and Chrome. This advantage gives Keep the possibility of being used even on other mobile operating systems and on the computer.
A Basque functionality is shared notes, which allows for collaborative use between family members or at work. You can create collective Riveillon targets for the next year and simply monitor everything.
Besides receiving annotations, it allows you to create lists, deal with media and scan documents (Image: André Magalhães/Canaltech)
The Evernote is the oldest tool on this list, but it is one of the most complete. In addition to traditional annotations, the resource allows you to integrate your target list into third party platforms, such as Gmail and , or access it by browser, cell phone, and tablet.
If you like working in old-fashioned fashion, you can do the goals in paper and digitize it in document format. You can link lists to workflows, and save notes as web pages.
As a good annotation editor, the Evernote allows to deal with various formats and related media. You can define your new year goals associated with audio notes or images to provide context.
There are free signing plans or payments, so the user can choose which one is to take care of his or her needs. If you don't want to pay, you give it to use it without any difficulty, so you start the year with more money in your pocket.
The No one who wants to be alone or get rid of any syphilis (Image: Reproduction/Google Play Store)
Nomo is a great application to help meet the goal of stopping drinking in the new year. If you've been over-exhausting alcohol recently, this app will be a good ally to keep your breath.
Created by a former alcohol addict, the service allows the creation of daily warnings to keep it motivated in the purpose. In addition, the user can add people who have died as a right hand (and emergency contact) to the task of avoiding alcohol.
Nom creates a kind of registration clock with data on the resolution: how long is it without drinking, days in succession, saved money and reports from other former dependents? Although it is focused on alcohol consumption, the app allows for other purposes such as drugs, pornography and cigarettes.
Finally, it is worth highlighting the exercise of distraction that helps to redirect the mind as much as the person is tempted. At the moment, we need to stimulate our minds with other things so that we do not get caught up in fraud.
The Way of Life allows you to convert your New Year's lists into intuitive memories (Photo: Play/Google Play Store)
The Way of Life is an application for changing old habits and creating new, healthier and more healthy habits according to their planning. It is not enough just to write your resolutions at the end of the year, because nothing will happen if they are not implemented.
The program has an intuitive tracker of habits that allows daily monitoring of evolution. The promise is to spend less than a minute answering questions about changing their unwanted habits, such as lack of physical activity, are too low or excessive in alcoholic drinks.
routine information is collected to identify whether its targets are being met. There is no restriction on what the app can monitor, so it allows for personal use or even work.
The Way of Life can work better than any list because it presents memories for special dates, weekdays and specific dates. It adds personal memories that help you understand why that warning is.
Did you draw up the apps list to make the resolutions of Riveillon? The Canaltech wants a Happy New Year!
Source:

stories.body:
InvestorPlace - Stock Market News, Stock Advice & Trading Tips  The stock market has been unforgiving for investors looking for tech stocks to buy in 2022.
Unfortunately, the turbulence will linger in early 2023 as recession fears remain entrenched until a meaningful U-turn in monetary policy. Tech stocks are cyclical in nature, and market movements will disproportionately affect them in both directions. This means the trough is always the best time to look for tech stocks to buy, and 2023 will be no different.
  We may already be in a recession, but there is no telling whether or not the worst is behind or in front of us. However, there are some arguments for why it may not be all doom and gloom for the stock market. First, the stock market bottoms out six months before the economy does. If we look at 2008, the recession was officially declared a year after it began. By that time, the S&P500 was already >40% down, and it only went down another 14% before rallying.
  Second, last year's selloffs have turned many tech stocks into value stocks. A further downturn will not be as severe for these stocks already changing hands at a hefty discount. Instead, we may see many tech stocks surge in late 2023 or early 2024 once the Federal Reserve reverses its monetary policy. Thus, 2023 will likely deliver the best time to buy the following 25 tech stocks:
  Intel (NASDAQ: INTC
  Cloudflare (NYSE: NET
  Tyler Technologies (NYSE: TYL
  ANSYS (NASDAQ: ANSS
  Fiverr (NYSE: FVRR
  PayPal (NASDAQ: PYPL
  Texas Instruments (NASDAQ: TXN
  Broadcom (NASDAQ: AVGO
  Micron (NASDAQ: MU
  Visa (NYSE: V
  Mastercard (NYSE: MA
  International Business Machines (NYSE: IBM
  Amazon (NASDAQ: AMZN
  Apple (NASDAQ: AAPL
  Alphabet (NASDAQ: GOOG GOOGL
  Microsoft (NASDAQ: MSFT
  Nvidia (NASDAQ: NVDA
  Advanced Micro Devices (NASDAQ: AMD
  Salesforce (NYSE: CRM
  Adobe (NASDAQ: ADBE
  Tesla (NASDAQ: TSLA
  Netflix (NASDAQ: NFLX
  Meta Platforms (NASDAQ: META
  Spotify (NYSE: SPOT
  Tencent Holdings (OTCMKTS: TCEHY
  Intel Corporation (INTC)
  Source: Shutterstock
  Intel (NASDAQ: INTC ) is one of the largest semiconductor manufacturers in the world, and one of the top tech stocks to buy . Its products are used in various industries, including automotive, aerospace, industrial, and healthcare. The company is currently trading at a trailing price-earnings ratio of 8x after a selloff that began in April last year, now down 62%.
  The current valuation of the company looks very compelling. Intel's long-term growth is expected to come from its data center business. These fast-growing data centers are significant consumers of Intel's processors and are expected to increase their spending on CPUs. As the cloud and data segment delivers robust growth, Intel is set to benefit from the increased demand in the long run. Its partnership with Mobileye is also making it benefit from the expansion of self-driving cars.
  Furthermore, Intel's stock is a good bet for investors looking for tech stocks to buy during the next market rebound, as the firm has been hit disproportionately hard by the selloffs. This is due to Intel having difficulties competing with its 2021 figures. However, as 2023 comes around, Intel will likely turn a corner and start growing once more investors realize the long-term value of this stock.
  Cloudflare Inc (NET)
  Source: IgorGolovniov / Shutterstock.com
  Cloudflare (NYSE: NET ) provides Internet solutions geared towards privacy. The company sells two main products: CDN and DNS. CDN allows customers to host their websites on Cloudflare's servers to protect themselves from DDoS attacks and save on bandwidth costs. On the other hand, Cloudflare's DNS aims to safeguard user anonymity while providing a fast resolver to browse the internet.
  Cloudflare is still going through an aggressive expansion phase by acquiring new clients, expanding its workforce, and increasing its global reach despite the market downturn. The company's financials also have remarkable growth despite slowing down. Revenue growth is still hovering around 50%, while losses are narrowing, and sustaining such growth rates will compel investors to pay a significant premium for NET stock as the economy rebounds.
  Moreover, the CDN market is expected to expand at a compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of 23.0% from 2022 to 2030. This is expected to drive Cloudflare's revenue and profit as we advance.
  Tyler Technologies (TYL)
  Source: Shutterstock
  Tyler Technologies (NYSE: TYL ) is a leading enterprise infrastructure software and services provider. The company offers various products, including enterprise asset management, mapping and GIS, public safety, detention management, and court case management systems. The company is now growing its business by acquiring new firms and increasing its product offerings. It has a strong presence in North America and the Caribbean. The company is expected to benefit from the growing demand for infrastructure software in the coming years.
  Investing in TYL stock is a great opportunity for investors looking to diversify their portfolios, being a global leader in providing software and technology solutions for the public sector while trading 41% down from its all-time high. Investors will resume paying a premium for the stock once the company continues its strong track record of financial performance and growth.
  First and foremost, Tyler Technologies has an impressive revenue growth rate despite short-term hurdles. Over the past decade, Tyler Technologies has consistently grown its revenue over a double-digit clip. This demonstrates the company's ability to expand and acquire new customers, as well as its ability to manage its existing customer base effectively.
  Secondly, Tyler Technologies has a diverse portfolio of products and services, which provides investors with numerous options for diversifying their portfolios. The company currently offers solutions for public sector organizations in finance, human resources, and enterprise resource planning. Tyler Technologies' solutions are also designed to easily integrate existing systems, allowing customers to reduce costs and increase efficiency.
  ANSYS (ANSS)
  ANSYS (NASDAQ: ANSS ) is a tech company with robust financials. It develops and markets engineering simulation software and services to the automotive, electronics, semiconductors, aerospace and defense, energy, healthcare, and consumer products industries. In the last three years, the company's revenue has increased at a growth rate of 12.9% , and I expect revenue will continue to increase at a double-digit clip in the long term.
  Of course, ANSYS' share price has had a rocky road over the past twelve months, with a 39% decline. However, a closer look at the company's strong financials and impressive net margin suggest that the stock could be a good long-term buy. ANSYS' net margin stands at 23.1%, ranked better than 93.31% of 2676 companies in the Software industry. That net margin is still growing while most companies are facing margin compression.
  Investors also should watch for signs of increased revenue and profits, which could result in a boost in ANSYS' share price. Its solid financials is enough to prompt a surge once investors start being more aggressive.
  Fiverr (FVRR)
  Source: shutterstock.com/whiteMocca
  Fiverr (NYSE: FVRR ) is a global online marketplace for entrepreneurs and freelancers. The company helps people do graphic and web design, writing and translation, video and voiceovers, coding, marketing, and other services at as low as $5. Fiverr is expanding its business and growing its user base by increasing its marketing activities. The company focuses on developing its user base, increasing revenue, and expanding its global reach. Fiverr is expected to benefit from the growing popularity of its services and the burgeoning freelance industry.
  FVRR stock is among the worst hit from the tech selloff, which could disturb some investors. However, the company has top-class customer retention and lightning-quick sales growth. Fiverr is narrowing its losses and becoming gig workers' go-to platform. Once the company fully recovers from its post-pandemic setback, I expect FVRR stock to surge.
  PayPal (PYPL)
  Source: Michael Vi / Shutterstock.com
  PayPal (NASDAQ: PYPL ) is a leading online payment company. The company provides online payment and money transfer services to individuals and businesses. Much like Fiverr, PayPal's stock is down significantly from its previous high. It is also down nearly 43% from its pre-pandemic stock price. However, PayPal is still a highly profitable business, and its top line continues to accelerate while profitability has picked up. The company is a widely used payment method that won't go out of relevancy due to these short-term hurdles.
  Overall, PayPal provides a great opportunity for investors to capitalize on its strong growth prospects. With a strong management team, a well-positioned digital payments market, and a growing buy now pay later (or BNPL) and cryptocurrency sector, PayPal is well-positioned to capitalize on the opportunities ahead. The current trough provides an excellent entry point for the stock.
  Texas Instruments (TXN), Broadcom (AVGO), and Micron Technology (MU)
  Source: Peshkova / Shutterstock
  Cyclical stocks are prone to selloffs during market downturns. This is because demand for their products experiences a slowdown during recessions. Especially those in the semiconductor space are usually among the worst affected by recession fears. However, they rebound faster and offer a better entry point. Such stocks include Texas Instruments Incorporated (NASDAQ: TXN Broadcomm Inc (NASDAQ: AVGO ), and Micron Technology Inc (NASDAQ: MU
  The semiconductor business is the largest segment of these companies' overall operations. While this sector has cooled down a lot, it still offers many opportunities going forward as it serves multiple end markets, including communications, industrial, automotive, computing, and the remarkably fast-growing cloud computing market. All of these areas have tremendous potential, and these stocks have fallen significantly in the past few months, making them excellent choices for tech stocks to buy.
  Moreover, semiconductors are still in high demand, as evidenced by these companies' robust sales growth. Another plus point is the CHIPS act aimed at boosting domestic semiconductor production. Thus, investors won't mind paying a higher premium for these stocks once the economy inevitably starts turning its gears again.
  Visa (V) and Mastercard (MA)
  Source: Teerasak Ladnongkhun/Shutterstock.com
  Investing in Visa (NYSE: V ) and Mastercard (NYSE: MA ) stocks can be smart for any investor looking to diversify their portfolio. Both companies are leaders in the financial industry and have a strong track record of growth and profitability. Many consider both of them to be tech stocks due to their accelerating digital payments system. Thus, if you are looking for safer tech stocks to buy, these two should be on the top of your list as they benefit from rate hikes and are significantly less risky than tech companies that depend on semiconductor sales or ad revenue.
  Furthermore, both of these companies wield remarkable net margins. Visa's is over 50% , and its revenue growth is near 19% in the latest quarter. Mastercard does have slightly weaker financials, but the effect on its stock price is negligible, and both move in correlation.
  Investors can assess each company's metrics, innovation, and dividend strength to decide which is the better fit for their particular investment goals. However, both companies offer nearly equal potential for investors and are viable investment options.
  IBM (IBM)
  Source: shutterstock.com/LCV
  Another safe tech stock to buy is IBM (NYSE: IBM ). While Big Blue won't make you a millionaire with outsized returns, it also won't crash as severely during a recession. This old company has continued to retain many clients who'll continue to buy services from IBM even during challenging economic conditions, forming an inelastic revenue segment.
  Moreover, IBM focuses on higher-growth segments such as cloud computing, AI, and the blockchain. These segments have already become the key driver, with the hybrid cloud segment having revenue growth of 15%. In comparison, software and consulting grew at 7% and 5%, respectively. If the trend continues, this company can catch up with the rest of the market in the long run.
  Amazon (AMZN)
  Source: Tada Images / Shutterstock.com
  Amazon (NASDAQ: AMZN ) offers a wide variety of products and services, from books and clothing to groceries and music. It is the leading online retailer and a major player in cloud computing, offering a wide variety of services and tools.
  Cloud computing is quickly becoming Amazon's most significant growth driver. It is able to consistently generate strong free cash flow, allowing it to invest in growth initiatives and return capital to shareholders. Even cryptocurrency networks such as Ethereum ETH-USD ) and many governments extensively use Amazon's servers.
  Moreover, its primary segment, e-commerce, is facing short-term difficulties. But that's expected, as many pandemic-driven customers haven't returned. Once that segment readjusts to a more normal long-term growth trend, I see AMZN stock stabilizing and growing again. The stock is below pre-pandemic prices and is set to deliver strong returns in the long run.
  Apple (AAPL)
  Source: Vytautas Kielaitis / Shutterstock.com
  Apple (NASDAQ: AAPL ) has been a leader in innovation for decades, and its products are known for their quality and usability. The company's reputation is simply unshakeable, and when you invest in Apple, you can benefit from its long-term success in the tech industry. The stock has consistently performed well over the years and has seen stellar returns except for the current short-term decline.
  The company is constantly innovating and creating new products and services. New iPhones every year form a very inelastic revenue segment due to Apple's closed-loop ecosystem and remarkable customer retention. Moreover, its products are a symbol of prosperity, especially in third-world countries where other luxury products aren't as popular. This is a definite competitive advantage for Apple that almost no one has.
  Its financials also reinforce the company's strength. Both the top and bottom lines expanded by 8.14% and 0.83% in Q3. Furthermore, unlike most other tech companies, Apple relies very little on ad revenue or highly cyclical segments. The company is still hiring, albeit at a reduced pace, and hasn't announced layoffs. That signals solid fundamentals in these conditions, which is why I think AAPL stock is perfect for investors looking for tech stocks to buy that balance potential upside and risk.
  Alphabet (GOOG, GOOGL) and
  Microsoft (MSFT)
  Source: IgorGolovniov / Shutterstock.com
  Alphabet (NASDAQ: GOOG GOOGL ) and Microsoft (NASDAQ: MSFT ) are perfect if you're looking for more established tech stocks to buy. Microsoft is a leading computer software company offering everything from computer operating systems to business software. It also owns several other tech companies, including LinkedIn, which will help boost its value in the long term. Thus, Microsoft is an excellent long-term tech stock for both beginners and experienced investors. The company's products, such as Microsoft Office and Windows, are a must for white-collar businesses.
  Alphabet also offers a wide variety of services, including search, cloud computing, and autonomous vehicles. Alphabet is one of the most innovative tech companies in the world, making it a great long-term investment. The company also owns Google and YouTube, guaranteeing that Alphabet remains relevant for years, if not decades, to come.
  All in all, they are evergreen investments firing on all cylinders and expanding their top lines. They have both struggled in the short term due to the economic landscape causing ad revenues to shrink and margins to compress, but they won't disappoint over the long run. Their relevancy will continue to make them grow alongside the economy and trade at a premium.
  NVIDIA (NVDA) and Advanced Micro Devices (AMD)
  Source: Michael Vi / Shutterstock.com
  Both NVIDIA (NASDAQ: NVDA ) and Advanced Micro Devices (NASDAQ: AMD ) are computer hardware companies specializing in graphics processing units (GPUs). GPUs are a critical component in computer gaming, making them solid long-term gaming investments. On top of their computer hardware, both NVIDIA and AMD also offer artificial intelligence (or AI) tools. AI is becoming increasingly important as more companies and services use it. Thus, NVDA and AMD are excellent long-term tech stocks to buy for both gamers and AI experts.
  Of course, both are down substantially from their previous peaks due to them being very cyclical.
  Last year, both companies saw profits surge due to a chip shortage. Cryptocurrency miners and scalpers contributed to this shortage by ordering large amounts of GPUs and using them for mining or selling them for more. However, The Ethereum network's shift to a proof-of-stake consensus and Bitcoin BTC-USD ) ‘s fall in value contributed massively to GPU demand plummeting. This has caused an oversaturation of GPUs as miners and scalpers try to sell them, and it is now hurting both companies.
  For 2023, AMD is the best of the two. The company offers a more diverse product portfolio of computer components. Thus, the current downturn is a great buy opportunity for AMD stock. I recommend NVIDIA if you are a risk-taker.
  Salesforce (CRM)
  Source: Shutterstock
  Salesforce (NYSE: CRM ) is a cloud computing company focused on customer relationship management ( CRM ). CRM is a popular business software that helps keep track of sales and marketing efforts. As the tech industry shifts towards cloud computing, CRM is becoming a more cloud-based system. Salesforce had a 57% decline from its peak, which seems oversold for a cloud computing stock.
  Recent acquisitions and partnerships have made Salesforce an even more attractive option for investors. The company has acquired several smaller businesses that have helped it expand its reach and broaden its portfolio. Salesforce has partnered with companies such as Slack, Google, and Amazon to create a comprehensive platform that can integrate with other services. This has allowed Salesforce to create a robust platform that businesses of all sizes can use.
  Adobe (ADBE)
  Source: Shutterstock
  Adobe (NASDAQ: ADBE ) is a software company focused on graphic design, video editing, and marketing. It makes some of the most popular design software in the world, such as Photoshop and Illustrator. Thus, its popularity makes it among the best tech stocks to buy if you are looking for an established company with long-term relevancy.
  Additionally, Adobe has strong and consistent financial performance, room to grow, and operating efficiencies and share repurchases that should help to improve its financials even further. In Q4 2022, Adobe reported a double-digit increase in revenue and a 0.27% increase in operating income, while its net income decreased by 4.6%. Moreover, the company is more reliant on selling software subscriptions , a growing segment.
  Not only that, subscriptions provide cash continuously for software that needs very little server-side upkeep. The company also has a cloud segment which could become a significant growth driver in the long run.
  Tesla (TSLA)
  Source: Khairil Azhar Junos/Shutterstock.com
  While Tesla (NASDAQ: TSLA ) might look like a falling knife to many after its 70% decline from its peak, it is reaching highly oversold territories. The stock might look traditionally overvalued due to its high PE, but investors should remember that its profits are doubling yearly. Its top-line growth is also consistent, near 50% growth. That should justify a much higher premium than its current value.
  Simply put, Tesla's financials should not warrant a selloff of this scale lasting too long. It is also by far the most established electric vehicle company in the world. Thus, I highly recommend the stock for 2023 as it offers a once-in-a-generation buying opportunity. Once the global economy picks up again, Tesla could surge much higher.
  Netflix (NFLX)
  Source: xalien / Shutterstock
  Netflix (NASDAQ: NFLX ) has recovered substantially from its selloff, but it still has a long way to go. The company has not only retained its pandemic subscribers but is now growing again, including a 6% top-line growth . That is impressive, considering not many people are binge-watching Netflix after 2020, and competition is getting tougher for streaming companies.
  In addition, Netflix is taking smart steps to narrow its losses by introducing ads, cutting headcount, and cracking down on account sharing. That might not be the best experience for some customers, but it is great news for investors as it opens up more revenue sources for the company. Beating expectations by a healthy margin is another major plus.
  Therefore, despite the strong recovery, the stock still provides an excellent long-term buying opportunity. Its stock price is still 20% below pre-pandemic prices, while its profits have more than doubled since.
  Meta Platforms (META)
  Source: Aleem Zahid Khan / Shutterstock.com
  Meta Platforms (NASDAQ: META ) is on the receiving end of a much harsher punishment than Netflix. That is because Netflix has taken smart steps to improve its profits, but Meta has done little. The biggest concern for investors with this company is its metaverse project. It is not easy to find anyone interested in such a project.
  Likewise, its metaverse segment is a money pit with little revenue generation. In the first three months of 2022, sales from the Reality Labs segment were only $285 million. That's $3.67 billion in operating losses.
  Of course, that's not a healthy segment, but it also shouldn't warrant a 68% selloff. Meta owns Facebook, WhatsApp, Instagram, and Messenger. Those four apps generated $9.3 billion in the first nine months of 2022, which puts total operating income at $5.66 billion. That deserves a much higher valuation in the long run.
  Spotify (SPOT)
  Source: Fabio Principe / Shutterstock.com
  Spotify (NYSE: SPOT ) has seen a turbulent ride since its IPO in 2018. Despite missing analysts' expectations for ad revenue and subscribers in its most recent earnings report, Spotify has posted some positive numbers. In Q3 2022, the company's revenue growth was 21.4%, and the company is in a very favorable position to execute numerous catalysts that could drive long-term upside. One is the Euro regaining its strength.
  Spotify's paid listeners are roughly two times more profitable than free listeners, and if the company can grow its paid subscriber base, it could bring significant long-term upside. Additionally, the company has much more room to grow in developing countries where it is still not popular.
  If the company can execute its catalysts, then it could see a significant long-term upside. With the right management and strategic decisions, SPOT stock could become a lucrative long-term investment. Especially once ad revenues recover, Spotify can turn a corner and surge.
  Tencent Holdings (TCEHY)
  Source: Shutterstock
  Tencent Holdings (OTCMKTS: TCEHY ) is one of the leading tech companies in China and is often overlooked by investors. The company offers a variety of products and services ranging from social media, cloud computing, gaming, fintech, and video streaming. Tencent's stock has declined more than 73.9% due to regulatory issues and a sluggish zero-covid economy in China. However, as China abandons the policy and reopens, it has surged 67.6%.
  In the most recent quarter, Tencent reported a 1.6% YoY decline in revenue. However, its cloud services business (Tencent Cloud) is accelerating, ranking top 2 in China's “Public Cloud Service Market.” Of course, Tencent is not without risk, as it relies heavily on China for growth. However, as China reopens and approves new games, TCEHY is undoubtedly among the top tech stocks to buy.
  On the date of publication, Omor Ibne Ehsan did not have (either directly or indirectly) any positions in the securities mentioned in this article. The opinions expressed in this article are those of the writer, subject to the InvestorPlace.com Publishing Guidelines.
  Omor Ibne Ehsan is a writer at InvestorPlace. He is also an active contributor to a variety of finance and crypto-related websites. He has a strong background in economics and finance and is a self taught investor. You can follow him on LinkedIn.
  More From InvestorPlace
  Buy This $5 Stock BEFORE This Apple Project Goes Live
  The Best $1 Investment You Can Make Today
  Early Bitcoin Millionaire Reveals His Next Big Crypto Trade “On Air”
  It doesn't matter if you have $500 or $5 million. Do this now.
  The post 25 Tech Stocks to Buy Before They Take Off in 2023 appeared first on InvestorPlace.

  Furthermore, Intel’s stock is a good bet for investors looking for tech stocks to buy during the next market rebound, as the firm has been hit disproportionately hard by the selloffs. This is due to Intel having difficulties competing with its 2021 figures. However, as 2023 comes around, Intel will likely turn a corner and start growing once more investors realize the long-term value of this stock.
  5 STOCKS THAT COULD DOUBLE OR TRIPLE IN THE MONTHS AHEAD
  Cloudflare Inc (NET)
  Source: IgorGolovniov / Shutterstock.com
  Cloudflare (NYSE: NET ) provides Internet solutions geared towards privacy. The company sells two main products: CDN and DNS. CDN allows customers to host their websites on Cloudflare’s servers to protect themselves from DDoS attacks and save on bandwidth costs. On the other hand, Cloudflare’s DNS aims to safeguard user anonymity while providing a fast resolver to browse the internet.
  Cloudflare is still going through an aggressive expansion phase by acquiring new clients, expanding its workforce, and increasing its global reach despite the market downturn. The company’s financials also have remarkable growth despite slowing down. Revenue growth is still hovering around 50%, while losses are narrowing, and sustaining such growth rates will compel investors to pay a significant premium for NET stock as the economy rebounds.
  Moreover, the CDN market is expected to expand at a compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of 23.0% from 2022 to 2030. This is expected to drive Cloudflare’s revenue and profit as we advance.
  5 STOCKS THAT COULD DOUBLE OR TRIPLE IN THE MONTHS AHEAD
  Tyler Technologies (TYL)
  Source: Shutterstock
  Tyler Technologies (NYSE: TYL ) is a leading enterprise infrastructure software and services provider. The company offers various products, including enterprise asset management, mapping and GIS, public safety, detention management, and court case management systems. The company is now growing its business by acquiring new firms and increasing its product offerings. It has a strong presence in North America and the Caribbean. The company is expected to benefit from the growing demand for infrastructure software in the coming years.
  Investing in TYL stock is a great opportunity for investors looking to diversify their portfolios, being a global leader in providing software and technology solutions for the public sector while trading 41% down from its all-time high. Investors will resume paying a premium for the stock once the company continues its strong track record of financial performance and growth.
  First and foremost, Tyler Technologies has an impressive revenue growth rate despite short-term hurdles. Over the past decade, Tyler Technologies has consistently grown its revenue over a double-digit clip. This demonstrates the company’s ability to expand and acquire new customers, as well as its ability to manage its existing customer base effectively.
  Secondly, Tyler Technologies has a diverse portfolio of products and services, which provides investors with numerous options for diversifying their portfolios. The company currently offers solutions for public sector organizations in finance, human resources, and enterprise resource planning. Tyler Technologies’ solutions are also designed to easily integrate existing systems, allowing customers to reduce costs and increase efficiency.
  5 STOCKS THAT COULD DOUBLE OR TRIPLE IN THE MONTHS AHEAD
  ANSYS (ANSS)
  ANSYS (NASDAQ: ANSS ) is a tech company with robust financials. It develops and markets engineering simulation software and services to the automotive, electronics, semiconductors, aerospace and defense, energy, healthcare, and consumer products industries. In the last three years, the company’s revenue has increased at a growth rate of 12.9%, and I expect revenue will continue to increase at a double-digit clip in the long term.
  Of course, ANSYS’ share price has had a rocky road over the past twelve months, with a 39% decline. However, a closer look at the company’s strong financials and impressive net margin suggest that the stock could be a good long-term buy. ANSYS’ net margin stands at 23.1%, ranked better than 93.31% of 2676 companies in the Software industry. That net margin is still growing while most companies are facing margin compression.
  Investors also should watch for signs of increased revenue and profits, which could result in a boost in ANSYS’ share price. Its solid financials is enough to prompt a surge once investors start being more aggressive.
  5 STOCKS THAT COULD DOUBLE OR TRIPLE IN THE MONTHS AHEAD
  Fiverr (FVRR)
  Source: shutterstock.com/whiteMocca
  Fiverr (NYSE: FVRR ) is a global online marketplace for entrepreneurs and freelancers. The company helps people do graphic and web design, writing and translation, video and voiceovers, coding, marketing, and other services at as low as $5. Fiverr is expanding its business and growing its user base by increasing its marketing activities. The company focuses on developing its user base, increasing revenue, and expanding its global reach. Fiverr is expected to benefit from the growing popularity of its services and the burgeoning freelance industry.
  FVRR stock is among the worst hit from the tech selloff, which could disturb some investors. However, the company has top-class customer retention and lightning-quick sales growth. Fiverr is narrowing its losses and becoming gig workers’ go-to platform. Once the company fully recovers from its post-pandemic setback, I expect FVRR stock to surge.
  5 STOCKS THAT COULD DOUBLE OR TRIPLE IN THE MONTHS AHEAD
  PayPal (PYPL)
  Source: Michael Vi / Shutterstock.com
  PayPal (NASDAQ: PYPL ) is a leading online payment company. The company provides online payment and money transfer services to individuals and businesses. Much like Fiverr, PayPal’s stock is down significantly from its previous high. It is also down nearly 43% from its pre-pandemic stock price. However, PayPal is still a highly profitable business, and its top line continues to accelerate while profitability has picked up. The company is a widely used payment method that won’t go out of relevancy due to these short-term hurdles.
  Overall, PayPal provides a great opportunity for investors to capitalize on its strong growth prospects. With a strong management team, a well-positioned digital payments market, and a growing buy now pay later (or BNPL) and cryptocurrency sector, PayPal is well-positioned to capitalize on the opportunities ahead. The current trough provides an excellent entry point for the stock.
  5 STOCKS THAT COULD DOUBLE OR TRIPLE IN THE MONTHS AHEAD
  Texas Instruments (TXN), Broadcom (AVGO), and Micron Technology (MU)
  Source: Peshkova / Shutterstock
  Cyclical stocks are prone to selloffs during market downturns. This is because demand for their products experiences a slowdown during recessions. Especially those in the semiconductor space are usually among the worst affected by recession fears. However, they rebound faster and offer a better entry point. Such stocks include
  Texas Instruments Incorporated
  (NASDAQ: TXN ), Broadcomm Inc
  (NASDAQ: AVGO ), and Micron Technology Inc (NASDAQ: MU ).
  The semiconductor business is the largest segment of these companies’ overall operations. While this sector has cooled down a lot, it still offers many opportunities going forward as it serves multiple end markets, including communications, industrial, automotive, computing, and the remarkably fast-growing cloud computing market. All of these areas have tremendous potential, and these stocks have fallen significantly in the past few months, making them excellent choices for tech stocks to buy.
  Moreover, semiconductors are still in high demand, as evidenced by these companies’ robust sales growth. Another plus point is the CHIPS act aimed at boosting domestic semiconductor production. Thus, investors won’t mind paying a higher premium for these stocks once the economy inevitably starts turning its gears again.
  5 STOCKS THAT COULD DOUBLE OR TRIPLE IN THE MONTHS AHEAD
  Visa (V) and Mastercard (MA)
  Source: Teerasak Ladnongkhun/Shutterstock.com
  Investing in Visa (NYSE: V ) and Mastercard
  (NYSE: MA ) stocks can be smart for any investor looking to diversify their portfolio. Both companies are leaders in the financial industry and have a strong track record of growth and profitability. Many consider both of them to be tech stocks due to their accelerating digital payments system. Thus, if you are looking for safer tech stocks to buy, these two should be on the top of your list as they benefit from rate hikes and are significantly less risky than tech companies that depend on semiconductor sales or ad revenue.
  Furthermore, both of these companies wield remarkable net margins. Visa’s is over 50%, and its revenue growth is near 19% in the latest quarter. Mastercard does have slightly weaker financials, but the effect on its stock price is negligible, and both move in correlation.
  Investors can assess each company’s metrics, innovation, and dividend strength to decide which is the better fit for their particular investment goals. However, both companies offer nearly equal potential for investors and are viable investment options.
  5 STOCKS THAT COULD DOUBLE OR TRIPLE IN THE MONTHS AHEAD
  IBM (IBM)
  Source: shutterstock.com/LCV
  Another safe tech stock to buy is IBM
  (NYSE: IBM ). While Big Blue won’t make you a millionaire with outsized returns, it also won’t crash as severely during a recession. This old company has continued to retain many clients who’ll continue to buy services from IBM even during challenging economic conditions, forming an inelastic revenue segment.
  Moreover, IBM focuses on higher-growth segments such as cloud computing, AI, and the blockchain. These segments have already become the key driver, with the hybrid cloud segment having revenue growth of 15%. In comparison, software and consulting grew at 7% and 5%, respectively. If the trend continues, this company can catch up with the rest of the market in the long run.
  5 STOCKS THAT COULD DOUBLE OR TRIPLE IN THE MONTHS AHEAD
  Amazon (AMZN)
  Source: Tada Images / Shutterstock.com
  Amazon (NASDAQ: AMZN ) offers a wide variety of products and services, from books and clothing to groceries and music. It is the leading online retailer and a major player in cloud computing, offering a wide variety of services and tools.
  Cloud computing is quickly becoming Amazon’s most significant growth driver. It is able to consistently generate strong free cash flow, allowing it to invest in growth initiatives and return capital to shareholders. Even cryptocurrency networks such as Ethereum
  ( ETH-USD ) and many governments extensively use Amazon’s servers.
  Moreover, its primary segment, e-commerce, is facing short-term difficulties. But that’s expected, as many pandemic-driven customers haven’t returned. Once that segment readjusts to a more normal long-term growth trend, I see AMZN stock stabilizing and growing again. The stock is below pre-pandemic prices and is set to deliver strong returns in the long run.
  5 STOCKS THAT COULD DOUBLE OR TRIPLE IN THE MONTHS AHEAD
  Apple (AAPL)
  Source: Vytautas Kielaitis / Shutterstock.com
  Apple (NASDAQ: AAPL ) has been a leader in innovation for decades, and its products are known for their quality and usability. The company’s reputation is simply unshakeable, and when you invest in Apple, you can benefit from its long-term success in the tech industry. The stock has consistently performed well over the years and has seen stellar returns except for the current short-term decline.
  The company is constantly innovating and creating new products and services. New iPhones every year form a very inelastic revenue segment due to Apple’s closed-loop ecosystem and remarkable customer retention. Moreover, its products are a symbol of prosperity, especially in third-world countries where other luxury products aren’t as popular. This is a definite competitive advantage for Apple that almost no one has.
  Its financials also reinforce the company’s strength. Both the top and bottom lines expanded by 8.14% and 0.83% in Q3. Furthermore, unlike most other tech companies, Apple relies very little on ad revenue or highly cyclical segments. The company is still hiring, albeit at a reduced pace, and hasn’t announced layoffs. That signals solid fundamentals in these conditions, which is why I think AAPL stock is perfect for investors looking for tech stocks to buy that balance potential upside and risk.
  5 STOCKS THAT COULD DOUBLE OR TRIPLE IN THE MONTHS AHEAD
  Alphabet (GOOG, GOOGL) and Microsoft (MSFT)
  Source: IgorGolovniov / Shutterstock.com
  Alphabet (NASDAQ: GOOG, GOOGL ) and
  Microsoft (NASDAQ: MSFT ) are perfect if you’re looking for more established tech stocks to buy. Microsoft is a leading computer software company offering everything from computer operating systems to business software. It also owns several other tech companies, including LinkedIn, which will help boost its value in the long term. Thus, Microsoft is an excellent long-term tech stock for both beginners and experienced investors. The company’s products, such as Microsoft Office and Windows, are a must for white-collar businesses.
  Alphabet also offers a wide variety of services, including search, cloud computing, and autonomous vehicles. Alphabet is one of the most innovative tech companies in the world, making it a great long-term investment. The company also owns Google and YouTube, guaranteeing that Alphabet remains relevant for years, if not decades, to come.
  All in all, they are evergreen investments firing on all cylinders and expanding their top lines. They have both struggled in the short term due to the economic landscape causing ad revenues to shrink and margins to compress, but they won’t disappoint over the long run. Their relevancy will continue to make them grow alongside the economy and trade at a premium.
  5 STOCKS THAT COULD DOUBLE OR TRIPLE IN THE MONTHS AHEAD
  NVIDIA (NVDA) and Advanced Micro Devices (AMD)
  Source: Michael Vi / Shutterstock.com
  Both NVIDIA (NASDAQ: NVDA ) and
  Advanced Micro Devices (NASDAQ: AMD ) are computer hardware companies specializing in graphics processing units (GPUs). GPUs are a critical component in computer gaming, making them solid long-term gaming investments. On top of their computer hardware, both NVIDIA and AMD also offer artificial intelligence (or AI) tools. AI is becoming increasingly important as more companies and services use it. Thus, NVDA and AMD are excellent long-term tech stocks to buy for both gamers and AI experts.
  Of course, both are down substantially from their previous peaks due to them being very cyclical.
  Last year, both companies saw profits surge due to a chip shortage. Cryptocurrency miners and scalpers contributed to this shortage by ordering large amounts of GPUs and using them for mining or selling them for more. However, The Ethereum network’s shift to a proof-of-stake consensus and Bitcoin ( BTC-USD ) ‘s fall in value contributed massively to GPU demand plummeting. This has caused an oversaturation of GPUs as miners and scalpers try to sell them, and it is now hurting both companies.
  For 2023, AMD is the best of the two. The company offers a more diverse product portfolio of computer components. Thus, the current downturn is a great buy opportunity for AMD stock. I recommend NVIDIA if you are a risk-taker.
  5 STOCKS THAT COULD DOUBLE OR TRIPLE IN THE MONTHS AHEAD
  Salesforce (CRM)
  Source: Shutterstock
  Salesforce (NYSE: CRM ) is a cloud computing company focused on customer relationship management ( CRM ). CRM is a popular business software that helps keep track of sales and marketing efforts. As the tech industry shifts towards cloud computing, CRM is becoming a more cloud-based system. Salesforce had a 57% decline from its peak, which seems oversold for a cloud computing stock.
  Recent acquisitions and partnerships have made Salesforce an even more attractive option for investors. The company has acquired several smaller businesses that have helped it expand its reach and broaden its portfolio. Salesforce has partnered with companies such as Slack, Google, and Amazon to create a comprehensive platform that can integrate with other services. This has allowed Salesforce to create a robust platform that businesses of all sizes can use.
  5 STOCKS THAT COULD DOUBLE OR TRIPLE IN THE MONTHS AHEAD
  Adobe (ADBE)
  Source: Shutterstock
  Adobe (NASDAQ: ADBE ) is a software company focused on graphic design, video editing, and marketing. It makes some of the most popular design software in the world, such as Photoshop and Illustrator. Thus, its popularity makes it among the best tech stocks to buy if you are looking for an established company with long-term relevancy.
  Additionally, Adobe has strong and consistent financial performance, room to grow, and operating efficiencies and share repurchases that should help to improve its financials even further. In Q4 2022, Adobe reported a double-digit increase in revenue and a 0.27% increase in operating income, while its net income decreased by 4.6%. Moreover, the company is more reliant on selling software subscriptions, a growing segment.
  Not only that, subscriptions provide cash continuously for software that needs very little server-side upkeep. The company also has a cloud segment which could become a significant growth driver in the long run.
  5 STOCKS THAT COULD DOUBLE OR TRIPLE IN THE MONTHS AHEAD
  Tesla (TSLA)
  Source: Khairil Azhar Junos/Shutterstock.com
  While Tesla (NASDAQ: TSLA ) might look like a falling knife to many after its 70% decline from its peak, it is reaching highly oversold territories. The stock might look traditionally overvalued due to its high PE, but investors should remember that its profits are doubling yearly. Its top-line growth is also consistent, near 50% growth. That should justify a much higher premium than its current value.
  Simply put, Tesla’s financials should not warrant a selloff of this scale lasting too long. It is also by far the most established electric vehicle company in the world. Thus, I highly recommend the stock for 2023 as it offers a once-in-a-generation buying opportunity. Once the global economy picks up again, Tesla could surge much higher.
  5 STOCKS THAT COULD DOUBLE OR TRIPLE IN THE MONTHS AHEAD
  Netflix (NFLX)
  Source: xalien / Shutterstock
  Netflix (NASDAQ: NFLX ) has recovered substantially from its selloff, but it still has a long way to go. The company has not only retained its pandemic subscribers but is now growing again, including a 6% top-line growth. That is impressive, considering not many people are binge-watching Netflix after 2020, and competition is getting tougher for streaming companies.
  In addition, Netflix is taking smart steps to narrow its losses by introducing ads, cutting headcount, and cracking down on account sharing. That might not be the best experience for some customers, but it is great news for investors as it opens up more revenue sources for the company. Beating expectations by a healthy margin is another major plus.
  Therefore, despite the strong recovery, the stock still provides an excellent long-term buying opportunity. Its stock price is still 20% below pre-pandemic prices, while its profits have more than doubled since.
  5 STOCKS THAT COULD DOUBLE OR TRIPLE IN THE MONTHS AHEAD
  Meta Platforms (META)
  Source: Aleem Zahid Khan / Shutterstock.com
  Meta Platforms (NASDAQ: META ) is on the receiving end of a much harsher punishment than Netflix. That is because Netflix has taken smart steps to improve its profits, but Meta has done little. The biggest concern for investors with this company is its metaverse project. It is not easy to find anyone interested in such a project.
  Likewise, its metaverse segment is a money pit with little revenue generation. In the first three months of 2022, sales from the Reality Labs segment were only $285 million. That’s $3.67 billion in operating losses.
  Of course, that’s not a healthy segment, but it also shouldn’t warrant a 68% selloff. Meta owns Facebook, WhatsApp, Instagram, and Messenger. Those four apps generated $9.3 billion in the first nine months of 2022, which puts total operating income at $5.66 billion. That deserves a much higher valuation in the long run.
  5 STOCKS THAT COULD DOUBLE OR TRIPLE IN THE MONTHS AHEAD
  Spotify (SPOT)
  Source: Fabio Principe / Shutterstock.com
  Spotify (NYSE: SPOT ) has seen a turbulent ride since its IPO in 2018. Despite missing analysts’ expectations for ad revenue and subscribers in its most recent earnings report, Spotify has posted some positive numbers. In Q3 2022, the company’s revenue growth was 21.4%, and the company is in a very favorable position to execute numerous catalysts that could drive long-term upside. One is the Euro regaining its strength.
  Spotify’s paid listeners are roughly two times more profitable than free listeners, and if the company can grow its paid subscriber base, it could bring significant long-term upside. Additionally, the company has much more room to grow in developing countries where it is still not popular.
  If the company can execute its catalysts, then it could see a significant long-term upside. With the right management and strategic decisions, SPOT stock could become a lucrative long-term investment. Especially once ad revenues recover, Spotify can turn a corner and surge.
  5 STOCKS THAT COULD DOUBLE OR TRIPLE IN THE MONTHS AHEAD
  Tencent Holdings (TCEHY)
  Source: Shutterstock
  Tencent Holdings (OTCMKTS: TCEHY ) is one of the leading tech companies in China and is often overlooked by investors. The company offers a variety of products and services ranging from social media, cloud computing, gaming, fintech, and video streaming. Tencent’s stock has declined more than 73.9% due to regulatory issues and a sluggish zero-covid economy in China. However, as China abandons the policy and reopens, it has surged 67.6%.
  In the most recent quarter, Tencent reported a 1.6% YoY decline in revenue. However, its cloud services business (Tencent Cloud) is accelerating, ranking top 2 in China’s “Public Cloud Service Market.” Of course, Tencent is not without risk, as it relies heavily on China for growth. However, as China reopens and approves new games, TCEHY is undoubtedly among the top tech stocks to buy.
  On the date of publication, Omor Ibne Ehsan did not have (either directly or indirectly) any positions in the securities mentioned in this article. The opinions expressed in this article are those of the writer, subject to the InvestorPlace.com Publishing Guidelines.
  Omor Ibne Ehsan is a writer at InvestorPlace. He is also an active contributor to a variety of finance and crypto-related websites. He has a strong background in economics and finance and is a self taught investor. You can follow him on LinkedIn.
